title: James Hoffmann V60 - Two People

parameters.grind_size: Medium-fine, slightly coarser than single serving to prevent over-extraction.

preparation_steps: Grind 60 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency.
Fold filter paper along seam and fit to V60.
Pre-heat with hot water and discard.
Add coffee to V60 and make a small well/divot in the center of the bed.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom (0:00): Start timer. Pour 120 grams of water (2x coffee dose) to saturate the grounds.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Start your timer. Pour exactly 120 grams of hot water — twice the coffee dose — evenly over the bed to fully wet the grounds. Aim for smooth coverage with no dry spots.

brewing_steps.instruction: Swirl (0:10): Gently swirl the brewer until the coffee slurry is even.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Swirl brewer until slurry is even
brewing_steps.audio_script: Now gently swirl the V60 so the slurry becomes uniform. This evens out saturation and prepares the bed for optimal extraction.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bloom continues (0:20): Let the coffee bloom until 0:50. This bloom period allows for de-gassing, which is crucial for fresh coffee.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Let's begin with James Hoffmann's expert bloom technique.

brewing_steps.instruction: First Main Pour (0:50 - 1:20): Pour up to 600 grams of water (60% of total brew water) within 30 seconds. This pour keeps the V60 topped up.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: First main pour to 600g • Within 30 seconds
brewing_steps.audio_script: Time for the first main pour. Raise the total to 600 grams — sixty percent of your brew water — over 30 seconds. Keep the bed high and your pour steady and centered, expanding in gentle circles.

brewing_steps.instruction: Second Main Pour (1:20 - 1:50): Gently pour up to 1000 grams of water (100% of total brew water) within 30 seconds.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Second main pour to 1000g • Within 30 seconds
brewing_steps.audio_script: Second main pour. Bring the total up to 1000 grams over the next 30 seconds. Pour gently to avoid channeling, finishing with a smooth, even surface.

brewing_steps.instruction: Stir (1:50): Stir gently clockwise and then anticlockwise (about 1 to 1.5 revolutions each way) to dislodge grounds from the sides. This step helps ensure all coffee particles are engaged in extraction.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Time for Hoffmann's signature stirring technique. Stir gently clockwise, then anticlockwise - about 1 to 1.5 revolutions each way. This dislodges grounds from the sides and ensures all coffee particles are fully engaged in extraction.

brewing_steps.instruction: Swirl (2:00): Gently swirl the brewer to flatten the coffee bed for even extraction. A flat bed is preferred for consistent drawdown.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Continue with the brewing process. Swirl (2:00): Gently swirl the brewer to flatten the coffee bed for even extraction. A flat bed is preferred for consistent drawdown. Take your time and focus on technique. Every step contributes to the final cup quality.

notes: Water Temperature: 95°C general, 100°C for high-quality light roasts, 90–95°C or 80–90°C for darker roasts. Aim to finish drawdown by 4 minutes. Perfect for 2 people.
